JobFullDesc: About Us: At Raytheon Missiles & Defense, you have the opportunity to try new things and make a bigger difference across a broader end-to-end solution, a richer technology and product set, an expanded range of disciplines, a growing global footprint and a more diverse team of colleagues and customers. Job Summary:Raytheon’s Patriot Systems area is looking for a financial specialist to support Field Services programs. This position will report to the Finance Manager responsible for these programs. You will work with all levels of management and partner with various functions to insure that requirements are prepared and delivered within the internal and external deadlines.Responsibilities to Anticipate: Program control financial support including monthly variance analysis, billing, forecasting, program metrics, program reviews and gate reviews Preparation of quarterly EACsPreparation of Earned Value reporting and IPMR deliverablesInteraction with Program team, project leads, billing and functions throughout IAMDPreparation of financial deliverablesPreparation of CDRLs in support of contractual requirementsFunding and de-obligation analysisAOP, 5YP, weekly sales forecasting Support proposal as necessaryAd-hoc investigation and reportingQualifications You Must Have:A related university degree and a minimum 5 years prior relevant experience, or an advanced degree in a related field and minimum 3 years’ experience.  Qualifications We Value:Excellent problem solving and analytical skillsAbility to work well in a team environment and independentlyAbility to clearly present and articulate program financial information to management and external customers.Ability to communicate effectively with peers and leadershipStrong problem solving abilityGood organizational skills and energetic self-starterEarned Value CertificationExperience with Apex, Rplan, PRISM and PMX Proficient in Excel and PowerPoint What We Offer:Whether you’re just starting out on your career journey or are an experienced professional, we offer a robust total rewards package that goes above and beyond with compensation; healthcare, wellness, retirement and work/life benefits; career development and recognition programs. Some of the first class benefits we offer include parental (including paternal) leave, flexible work schedules, achievement awards, educational assistance and child/adult backup care.
